chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr.

defendant.name: Ganz-Brown, Robert Henry, Jr.
defendant.address: 11567 E Hazel Prairie Rd, Lake Nebagamon, WI 54849

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:42 AM Defendant Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Matthew Izzard-sworn and testified. Detective at DCSD. Vehicle was stolen from Lucius Woods park, Later chased by deputy but not caught. Vehicle later found by homeowner on his property. Amanda Akervik stated defendant stole vehicle. Witness identifies defendant. Key for vehicle was found in defendant's jail property. Was some damage to vehicle. 
Att Hoffman cross examines.
State rests
Defense- no evidence
State moves for bind over
Att Hoffman opposes
Court finds probable cause, binds him over for arraignment. Sets date. Bond and conditions to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:05 AM Defendant Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State lets court know that Attorney Hoffman advised him there is a conflict and a new attorney will need to be appointed.
Court reviews file; questions waiver of time limits
Attorney Hoffman indicates Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing
State does not object to rescheduling.
Court finds good cause to adjourn.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with EF or 2812 Engdahl Rd, Lakeside WI

1:43 PM Defendant Robert Henry Ganz-Brown Jr. appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Ryan Reid.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. Not guilty plea(s) entered. 
State requesting 7500cb No contact with EF or 2812 Engdahl Rd Lakeside WI.
State has concerns about defendant being resident of Douglas County.  Prior criminal history, probation revoked prior x2, MN history with FTA. Notes this is the 4th open Douglas County file.
Attorney Reid-requests $1000cb. local Douglas County address, lifelong resident, family ties, self employed. Qualifies for PD services.
Court questions contacts with the address provided; who's residence it is.
Attorney unsure of who's address it is but represents that he lives there.
Court reviews concerns; Orders $5000cb No contact with EF or 2812 Engdahl Rd, Lakeside WI
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:45 am.
